<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GEOPOLITICS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/16/dark-future-looms-women-living-afghanistan?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Afghanistan’s Women Fear a Return to a Dark Past
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/16/dark-future-looms-women-living-afghanistan?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Burqa clad women walk past a billboard put up on the wall of a beauty salon in Kabul" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82MjcyL2FfcG9zdGVyX29mX3dvbWVuX2luX2FmZ2hhbmlzdGFuLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Sajjad Hussain/AFP via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">“Today, as I was on my way home, I glanced at the beauty salon where I used to go for manicures. The shop front, which had been decorated with beautiful pictures of girls, had been <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/2021/aug/15/an-afghan-woman-in-kabul-now-i-have-to-burn-everything-i-achieved?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">whitewashed overnight</a>,” one Afghan female university student wrote for The Guardian this Sunday.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Now that the Taliban has returned to power in Afghanistan, the country’s women fear their civil rights are about to be pulled out <a href="https://apnews.com/article/religion-taliban-7ab054c063e4ea1c14be9e4811f42982?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">from under them</a> as the regime reimposes its radical Islamic fundamentalist policies. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">When the Taliban last ruled Afghanistan, from 1996–2001, Afghan women were not allowed to...</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Work outside of the home</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Attend school</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Leave home without a male escort and their faces and bodies covered</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Since the US ousted the Taliban from power in 2001, Afghan women <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/u-s-withdraws-future-afghan-women-girls-hangs-balance-n1266478?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">made gains</a> in education and the workforce. Girls’ enrollment in primary school nearly doubled, and literacy rates among women rose from 20% in 2005 to 39% in 2017. An estimated 1.6 million more Afghan women are employed now over 20 years ago.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But signs are cropping up throughout the country that all of the progress could be reversed. For instance, female employees at some banks are reportedly being told to stay home and that male relatives could take over their duties.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Taliban said this spring that it would allow women to participate in public life when it assumed power. Experts are skeptical they'll follow through. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">More updates from Afghanistan</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">President Biden</strong>, facing loads of criticism over his handling of the situation, <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2021/08/16/politics/biden-afghanistan-speech/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a> in a video address that events in Afghanistan “did unfold more quickly than we had anticipated,” but that he doesn’t regret his decision to withdraw US troops from the country.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Hundreds of Afghan civilians</strong> <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/2021/08/16/afghan-kabul-airport/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">clung</a> to the sides of a US military aircraft as it was taking off in hopes of fleeing the country. At least seven people at Kabul’s airport have been confirmed dead.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">United</strong>, Emirates, and several other major airlines <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2021/08/16/business/united-emirates-virgin-airlines-afghanistan-intl-hnk/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rerouted their flights</a> to avoid Afghan airspace as Kabul’s airport closed to commercial flights. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Washington Post</strong> publisher Fred Ryan <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/08/16/afghanistan-white-house-asked-to-protect-journalists-at-kabul-airport.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pleaded with the White House</a> to protect more than 200 journalists, staffers, and family members from the WaPo, New York Times, and Wall Street Journal who were in danger at the airport.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Afghanistan’s</strong> neighboring countries are <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/live/2021/08/16/world/taliban-afghanistan-news/nations-expect-an-outpouring-of-refugees-as-the-afghan-crisis-escalates?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">bracing for a flood of refugees</a>. Five Mediterranean nations have requested EU-level talks about how to respond. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AUTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/16/us-launches-investigation-teslas-autopilot-system?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Tesla's Autopilot Runs Into Turbulence
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/16/us-launches-investigation-teslas-autopilot-system?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="An illustration of a parked Tesla" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82MjY4L2FuX2lsbHVzdHJhdGlvbl9vZl9hX3BhcmtlZF90ZXNsYS5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">US auto regulators have <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2021/8/16/22626819/tesla-autopilot-crash-emergency-vehicle-probe-nhtsa?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">launched an investigation</a> into Tesla’s advanced driver-assistance system, Autopilot, ramping up scrutiny of Elon Musk’s self-driving efforts.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The investigation stems from 11 incidents in which drivers using Tesla’s Autopilot feature struck stationary first-responder vehicles. 17 people were injured in these crashes, and one died.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">What is Autopilot? </strong></span><span>It’s Tesla’s limited self-driving system that can center cars in lanes and have them maintain certain speeds. </span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">What isn’t Autopilot? </strong></span><span>Autopilot. The company’s marketing of the technology (including the name) has been </span><span><a href="https://www.ft.com/content/afb75ffd-44eb-4ae3-8bca-ae830fa52111?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">criticized</a></span><span> for making drivers feel like the car can steer itself when the driver should be engaged at the wheel. Out of 5 “levels” used to rank self-driving capabilities, with 5 being fully autonomous, Autopilot hits just Level 2.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why it matters: </strong>The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration, the agency leading the investigation, has the power to make regulations or even force Tesla to recall vehicles. Investors are not <em>not</em> worried—Tesla shares sank more than 4% on the news. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Interestingly, many automated driving systems are designed to <a href="https://www.wired.com/story/tesla-autopilot-why-crash-radar/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">only detect moving objects</a>, because it would render them useless (and potentially make cars even more dangerous) if they were to respond to stationary objects on the road. </p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FOOD
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/16/biden-administration-approves-historic-boost-food-stamp-benefits?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Food Stamps Get Historic Boost
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="bunch of vegetables" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82MjY5L2dyb2NlcnkuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Unsplash</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Biden administration permanently <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/08/15/us/politics/biden-food-stamps.html?referringSource=articleShare" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">boosted food stamp benefits</a> by over 25% to an average of $157 per month—the largest jump in the program’s history. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture</strong>: While officials said the increase wasn’t related to the pandemic, Covid-19 led to heightened food insecurity in the US. More than 42 million people were collecting SNAP (Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program) benefits in May, up from nearly 37 million in February 2020. During the pandemic, all food stamp recipients got a 15% supplement, but the temporary aid expires at the end of September. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Advocates for expanding the aid argued that the existing plan was based on unrealistic assumptions. For example, the USDA set a $22/day food budget for a family of four and assumed an adult woman would <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/08/15/us/politics/biden-food-stamps.html?referringSource=articleShare" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">spend</a> less than 50 cents on cheese each month. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“We need to modernize those assumptions based on what’s actually happening in kitchens and in homes across America,” Agriculture Secretary Tom Vilsack said.  </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>The food stamp bump, which is expected to cost an extra $20 billion a year, is one slice of the Biden administration's broader efforts to expand the country’s social safety net.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><br><br></p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPONSORED BY THE MOTLEY FOOL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
So That’s How They Make Money?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.fool.com/ext-content/want-to-know-where-to-invest-1000-right-now-2/?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=contentmarketing&utm_campaign=5gsa-supercycle-1k&aid=9467&paid=9467&waid=9467&source=esamnbwdg0310016&psource=esamnbwdg0310016&wsource=esamnbwdg0310016&testId=a-sa-5g-sc-1k&cellId=0&campaign=sa-5g-sc" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="The Motley Fool" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL3BsYWNlbWVudC9pbWFnZXMvMjE2NC8xNjI3NTcwMzU4LUZpbmFuY2UtMTQ3LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6ImNvbWV0LW1vcm5pbmdicmV3IiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Wow, ya learn something new everyday—money is made with cute lil tiny cranes. You knew you read this newsletter for a reason. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Speaking of reading this for good reason (yes, perfect), <a href="https://www.fool.com/mms/mark/a-sa-5g-sc-1k?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=contentmarketing&utm_campaign=5gsa-supercycle-1k&aid=9467&paid=9467&waid=9467&source=esamnbwdg0310016&psource=esamnbwdg0310016&wsource=esamnbwdg0310016" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The Motley Fool</a> has some info you need if you have $1,000 that was recently constructed out of small blocks. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Sure you could think about the big players TMF has recommended before like Amazon (<strong style="color:#000">up 21,635%</strong>) or Booking Holdings (<strong style="color:#000">up 9,087%</strong>). But there’s likely a coming 5G boom, and that’s where TMF are recommending you consider putting some casheesh.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">An under-the-radar company out of PA makes a part that’s so essential to Apple’s iPhone that this little doohickey is in every single one of those smartphones. And since it’s small, your $1k can go further.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So give your portfolio the chance to grow—with or without cranes—by learning about this stock once you <a href="https://www.fool.com/mms/mark/a-sa-5g-sc-1k?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=contentmarketing&utm_campaign=5gsa-supercycle-1k&aid=9467&paid=9467&waid=9467&source=esamnbwdg0310016&psource=esamnbwdg0310016&wsource=esamnbwdg0310016" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">join The Motley Fool Stock Adviso</a>r.</p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SOCIAL MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/16/anonymous-chat-app-yik-yak-back-four-years-shutting?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Digital Burn Book Returns
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/08/16/anonymous-chat-app-yik-yak-back-four-years-shutting?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Yik Yak promo image" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82MjcwL3lpa195YWtfcHJvbW9faW1hZ2UucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Back by unpopular demand: the anonymous chat app Yik Yak, which <a href="https://mashable.com/article/yik-yak-is-back-2021?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">returned</a> to the App Store yesterday four years after shutting down. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Yik Yak is the id unleashed.</strong> It allows people to post anonymously to other Yik Yak users within a 5-mile radius, providing a forum for steamy gossip like, “To the hot guy in British Lit, I love the way you chew on your pencil.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In 2014, one year after the original version launched, Yik Yak exploded in popularity among a certain demographic (high schoolers and college students), and even attained a $400 million valuation.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But all the things that you imagine <em>could</em> go wrong with a purely anonymous app—bullying, harassment, bomb threats—did, and it shut down in 2017 after its star faded.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The revived Yik Yak said it’s trying to clean up the toxicity by instituting a one-strike no bullying policy and providing links to mental health resources—though most of the functionality appears similar to V1.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>“​​We’ll probably know if Yik Yak catches on with Gen Z if it starts causing TikTok drama. That’s sort of how you know something’s a hit these days,” internet trends writer <a href="https://www.garbageday.email/p/there-would-be-no-screen-only-a-locomotive?token=eyJ1c2VyX2lkIjo0NjIyNTQsInBvc3RfaWQiOjQwMDc5NzkxLCJfIjoiNEh0aVciLCJpYXQiOjE2MjkxNDg3MzksImV4cCI6MTYyOTE1MjMzOSwiaXNzIjoicHViLTkzMTciLCJzdWIiOiJwb3N0LXJlYWN0aW9uIn0.wwI0ZGYY-fz3Q1vP3CsmnRDmiU63yMTkua8k0mNjADk" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Ryan Broderick</a> said. </p>

policies. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhen the Taliban last ruled Afghanistan, from 1996–2001, Afghan women were not allowed home\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAttend school\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eLeave home without a male escort and their faces and bodies covered\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSince the US ousted the Taliban from power in 2001, Afghan women \u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/u-s-withdraws-future-afghan-women-girls-hangs-balance-n1266478?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emade gains\u003c/a\u003e in education and the workforce. Girls’ enrollment in primary school nearly doubled, and literacy rates among women rose from 20% in 2005 to 39% in 2017. An estimated 1.6 million more Afghan women are employed now over 20 years ago.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut signs are cropping up throughout the country that all of the progress could be reversed. For instance, female employees at some banks are reportedly being told to stay home and that male relatives could take over their duties.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe Taliban said this spring that it would allow women to participate in public life when it assumed power. Experts are skeptical they'll follow through. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eMore updates from Afghanistan\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003ePresident Biden\u003c/strong\u003e, facing loads of criticism over his handling of the situation, \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2021/08/16/politics/biden-afghanistan-speech/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e in a video address that events in Afghanistan “did unfold more quickly than we had anticipated,” but that he doesn’t regret his decision to withdraw US troops from the country.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHundreds of Afghan civilians\u003c/strong\u003e \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/2021/08/16/afghan-kabul-airport/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eclung\u003c/a\u003e to the sides of a US military aircraft as it was taking off in hopes of fleeing the country. At least seven people at Kabul’s airport have been confirmed dead.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eUnited\u003c/strong\u003e, Emirates, and several other major airlines \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2021/08/16/business/united-emirates-virgin-airlines-afghanistan-intl-hnk/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ererouted their flights\u003c/a\u003e to avoid Afghan airspace as Kabul’s airport closed to commercial flights. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWashington Post\u003c/strong\u003e publisher Fred Ryan \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/08/16/afghanistan-white-house-asked-to-protect-journalists-at-kabul-airport.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epleaded with the White House\u003c/a\u003e to protect more than 200 journalists, staffers, and family members from the WaPo, New York Times, and Wall Street Journal who were in danger at the airport.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAfghanistan’s\u003c/strong\u003e neighboring countries are \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/live/2021/08/16/world/taliban-afghanistan-news/nations-expect-an-outpouring-of-refugees-as-the-afghan-crisis-escalates?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebracing for a flood of refugees\u003c/a\u003e. Five Mediterranean nations have requested EU-level talks about how to respond. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eUS auto regulators have \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2021/8/16/22626819/tesla-autopilot-crash-emergency-vehicle-probe-nhtsa?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elaunched an investigation\u003c/a\u003e into Tesla’s advanced driver-assistance system, Autopilot, ramping up scrutiny of Elon Musk’s self-driving efforts.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe investigation stems from 11 incidents in which drivers using Tesla’s Autopilot feature struck stationary first-responder vehicles. 17 people were injured in these crashes, and one died.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat is Autopilot? \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIt’s Tesla’s limited self-driving system that can center cars in lanes and have them maintain certain speeds. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat isn’t Autopilot? \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAutopilot. The company’s marketing of the technology (including the name) has been \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/afb75ffd-44eb-4ae3-8bca-ae830fa52111?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecriticized\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e for making drivers feel like the car can steer itself when the driver should be engaged at the wheel. Out of 5 “levels” used to rank self-driving capabilities, with 5 being fully autonomous, Autopilot hits just Level 2.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy it matters: \u003c/strong\u003eThe National Highway Traffic Safety Administration, the agency leading the investigation, has the power to make regulations or even force Tesla to recall vehicles. Investors are not \u003cem\u003enot\u003c/em\u003e worried—Tesla shares sank more than 4% on the news. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eInterestingly, many automated driving systems are designed to \u003ca href=\"https://www.wired.com/story/tesla-autopilot-why-crash-radar/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eonly detect moving objects\u003c/a\u003e, because it would render them useless (and potentially make cars even more dangerous) if they were to respond to href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/08/15/us/politics/biden-food-stamps.html?referringSource=articleShare\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eboosted food stamp benefits\u003c/a\u003e by over 25% to an average of $157 per month—the largest jump in the program’s history. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture\u003c/strong\u003e: While officials said the increase wasn’t related to the pandemic, Covid-19 led to heightened food insecurity in the US. More than 42 million people were collecting SNAP (Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program) benefits in May, up from nearly 37 million in February 2020. During the pandemic, all food stamp recipients got a 15% supplement, but the temporary aid expires at the end of September. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAdvocates for expanding the aid argued that the existing plan was based on unrealistic assumptions. For example, the USDA set a $22/day food budget for a family of four and assumed an adult woman would \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/08/15/us/politics/biden-food-stamps.html?referringSource=articleShare\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003espend\u003c/a\u003e less than 50 cents on cheese each month. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“We need to modernize those assumptions based on what’s actually happening in kitchens and in homes across America,” Agriculture Secretary Tom Vilsack said.  \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eThe food stamp bump, which is expected to cost an extra $20 billion a year, is one slice of the Biden administration's broader efforts to expand the country’s social safety net.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003cbr\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBack by unpopular demand: the anonymous chat app Yik Yak, which \u003ca href=\"https://mashable.com/article/yik-yak-is-back-2021?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereturned\u003c/a\u003e to the App Store yesterday four years after shutting down. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eYik Yak is the id unleashed.\u003c/strong\u003e It allows people to post anonymously to other Yik Yak users within a 5-mile radius, providing a forum for steamy gossip like, “To the hot guy in British Lit, I love the way you chew on your pencil.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn 2014, one year after the original version launched, Yik Yak exploded in popularity among a certain demographic (high schoolers and college students), and even attained a $400 million valuation.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut all the things that you imagine \u003cem\u003ecould\u003c/em\u003e go wrong with a purely anonymous app—bullying, harassment, bomb threats—did, and it shut down in 2017 after its star faded.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe revived Yik Yak said it’s trying to clean up the toxicity by instituting a one-strike no bullying policy and providing links to mental health resources—though most of the functionality appears similar to V1.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003e“​​We’ll probably know if Yik Yak catches on with Gen Z if it starts causing TikTok drama.
